MemberSignature.Value: public void BeginTextEditing ();
.method public hidebysig instance void BeginTextEditing() cil managed
Public Sub BeginTextEditing ()
public: void BeginTextEditing();
member this.BeginTextEditing : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Begins editing of the annotation text by an end-user.

remarks.format:
## Remarks After calling this method, the annotation displays an editing box that allows the user to edit the annotation text.
Call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation.StopTextEditing%2A> method to cancel this mode programmatically. Note that editing also ends when the end-user hits the Enter key if the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation.IsMultiline%2A> property is `false`, or when the end-user clicks outside the editing box if the value is `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void EndPlacement ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void EndPlacement() cil managed
Public Overrides Sub EndPlacement ()
public: override void EndPlacement();
override this.EndPlacement : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Ends user placement of an annotation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Ends an annotation placement operation previously started by a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BeginPlacement%2A> method call. You are not required to call this method, because placement will automatically end when an end-user enters all required points. However, it is useful when an annotation placement operation needs to be aborted for some reason.

MemberSignature.Value: public void StopTextEditing ();
.method public hidebysig instance void StopTextEditing() cil managed
Public Sub StopTextEditing ()
public: void StopTextEditing();
member this.StopTextEditing : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Stops end-user editing of the annotation text.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call this method to cancel a text editing operation that was started with a call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation.BeginTextEditing%2A> method.
Note that if the end user double-clicks the annotation, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation.BeginTextEditing%2A> method will be automatically called.
